metadata.Title: CVE-2015-4004 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
The OZWPAN driver in the Linux kernel through 4.0.5 relies on an untrustedlength field during packet parsing, which allows remote attackers to obtainsensitive information from kernel memory or cause a denial of service(out-of-bounds read and system crash) via a crafted packet.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-4004` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.3.0-1-generic - 4.3.0-1.10
linux-image-4.3.0-1-generic-lpae - 4.3.0-1.10
